I know a project, Fanfare, that's been struggling for a while, they ended up doing a tokensale the day of the big crypto crash earlier this year, and have been scraping by ramen style and delivering milestones with little to no funding. 

They're offering Music NFTs, and the users of the platform really love the service, especially the artists, which signup in droves with multiple every day. This is because streaming platforms typically only offer a small piece of the profits to their artists, while Fanfare offers 85% of proceeds to their artists. 

This has enormous potential to rebalance the music industry in favor of the artists, finally.

survey showed that 66% of the users would be very disappointed if the platform disappeared tomorrow. 
survey results: https://37r0dkd5kza.typeform.com/report/c4lng2Wg/c4ialz6vQNqc0H8q

Their website is https://beta.fanfare.fm and for disclosure purposes, I'm Tyler Sehr, an early investor/friend of the team.

My co-founder and I are working on "Slik - A Decentralized End-to-end Encrypted Data Storage Protocol". 

*It helps solve the data leaks and ransomware losses problem that plagues us using immutability of blockchain and decentralized storage. 

*Also, allows different dApps to reuse the same decentralized infrastructure, by using the Slik protocol, and their private keys. 

We're both - ex-Googlers, and have been working on it for 7 months now. 30% MoM user growth and tested tech on all platforms. Happy to share demo videos. 

Website: https://sliksafe.com

embeds.title: Slik Safe | Private, Decentralized, File Backups
embeds.description: Slik Safe is a decentralized, end-to-end encrypted file backup solution.

We are building ZeFi - **imagine Revolut but built entirely on DeFi**. ZeFi lets users save, spend and earn up to 8% APY from a single app.  https://zefi.io/invite/magic [Invite Link if you're in the US]

-We want to be the Revolut but built on DeFi.
-**Future plans**
-One click access to loans/ DeFi Index Funds.

Super early phases- working on killing Shutterstock with web3. They are a $1B marketplace paying their suppliers just 15-40% of the income they generate. Governance and overflow profit to the photographers and push their split as close to 100% as possible. Shutterstock cannot compete without destroying their existing bloated business.
This is the way

1. Create DAO
2. Give ownership to customers
3. Customers vote away value capture
4. DAO creators make money from ownership instead 
5. Disrupt every C-corp ever
Anyone else who's doing this, send me a DM; let's hold hands and hunt some c-corps together
What do you mean by voting away value capture?
If the customers own the DAO, the DAO doesn't make a profit

The DAO becomes a protocol between buyers, vendors/workers; with 0-cut going to an owner in the middle. 

It has the same mechanics of an aggregator or moat, with none of the value capture.

DAOs are (maybe) low-end disruptions relative to C-corps, because they can do the same thing as a company (probably) without taking a cut on top (because the DAO is a literally a computer program)
Completely agree, I think there’s maybes and probably a are worth a large bet

aye, 

if it's even a 1% chance, it means every c-corp in the world is up for grabs by a DAO version. 

Take a $10billion company. Make it $10million instead with a few thousand lines of code. Rip through the economy, rebuilding the whole thing.
the pie's is too big to ignore when the pie is *everything*
The pie is at least aggregators that don’t add any value. Like DAO YouTube/TikTok is tough because of the algos they provide. But Shutterstock does nothing I’m aware of to warrant their 85% cut
I think that's correct; the easiest ones are the ones with the highest margin to value ratio
wouldn't that be ones protected by regulatory capture?
There are huge number of companies who are following shutterstock model and they all can be replaced by DAO

It's also worth noting that it's wildly easier for a DAO to buy from another DAO. 

Because a DAO can swap tokens, and then you can create abstractions upon the DAO that let one governance token control another token. 

For example, if A owns B, then you can make A-token vote on proposals by B-token, proportional to the ownership. 

That let's you vote with an entire portfolio of governance tokens, which lets you pool your tokens into single delegate programs that apply the same rules to several different DAOs. 

For example, in Strangemood (our Steam as a DAO), if we want every sub-DAO to collectively fund a conference, we can abstract away the need to vote for each DAO to fund their portion. 

That lets DAOs "merge together" with their customers and suppliers without making things harder to coordinate. 

That desire is quite strong, and a traditional C-corp can realistically just say "lol, here's my whole company, go nuts", it means the DAO is incentivized to buy from the DAO competitor. 

And since the DAO borg-machine takes no value capture, it's (theoretically) more efficient and cheaper; one big new economy with a network effect
@evann what would be the simplest possible starting point for creating one of these consumer/employee owned DAOs?

You could also take this same model and start building real-world government policies, like putting fire-alarms in buildings, ensuring food safety, creating schools and so on. 

And then you can pool those policies together, but  each individual person gets to vote in a way that's as fine grained as they'd like; across the whole economy.
Take a company
strip it of value capture
give it to the customers and the people who build on it
restructure it as a protocol
Strangemood.org (which is the thing I'm working on) is a good example
Might be a noob question 🙃 , but just curious, if there is no value capture, what would be the incentive for the people creating these protocols?

Take Steam, make a Steam a protocol, make it have a community token account, give game devs ownership over that community token account, they vote to fund off-chain pieces like storage, IP protection, GUIs, etc.
Ownership
Houses have no value capture
Also, it's not like there's *no* money to be made; you just move the money to the customers and the vendors and the ecosystem and the workers

For Steam's example; if want to make money, invest in the ecosystem and the games. If the pitch is "Steam makes $600million a year, we're going to distribute that to game devs and ecosystem instead", then follow the money; make games, make ecosystem projects, etc.
I see, so basically, the people creating the protocols would also own some portion of the protocol's tokens?
I should say that this is *all* an experiment; very much a "I wonder if this works" sort of thing
yes
oh ok got it, interesting
Like in Strangemood's case; we give grants to anyone who makes an ecosystem project
But we just modeled it after Solana, which also gives grants

that means Solana and Strangemood are aligned; if Strangemood wins, we onboard every gamer in the world onto Solana, and so Solana is incentivized to help. 

But all the games and ecosystem projects on Strangemood have the same effect; and so do their suppliers and players

It's worth noting that if you take a company, strip it of value capture, and give it all to your customers, it's unlikely that it will be worth significant amounts of money. 

But that's okay, because you're indexing from 0, and the big company is indexing from billions
You look up and see money, they look down and see losses

Still in its very early stages but starting to work on a web3 project that registers/replaces UPCs (universal product codes) using a smart contract. For example, ENS domains: used for decentralized websites where smart contract acts as registrar to register .eth domain. So possibly, OCPC (on chain product code)?: used for registering products (data would include: product origin, ingredients, mfg details, waste, supply chain, etc.). Manufacturers would register their OCPC as they do for UPCs but now it's on-chain. Eventually possibly useful to leverage data for inventory management across the supply chain. Still ironing out the idea - feel free to reach out if interested.
Awesome, how can you incentivize manufacturers to do the work to list ok OCPC?
UPCs are like a weird old massive network effect

Currently bootstrapping a decentralized video distribution platform-- wylloh.com-- for feature films and series, with support from the incredible team at MintGate. We're prepping for our first project, an independent feature from a twice Oscar-nominated special effects studio founder, estimated to release early 2022 (VFX being added to edit this month). Our platform offers tokens that unlock viewing and include commercial licenses to stream to one viewer, essentially automating the distribution process. Enables other streaming platforms to license titles without lengthy (or any) negotiations. Acquire tokenized licenses at market prices to meet real-time or expected demand. Current push is to onboard additional notable artists, and to create awards DAO pngwin.org (AMPAS for Web3) that will onramp those established filmmakers and showrunners with Eth awards/rewards. Wylloh tokens can currently unlock a stream, but ultimate vision is to enable offline viewing with embedded media, a la virtual DVD. Can trade, gift, resell, etc. Owners of n copies can also screen the film to an audience of n viewers, charging for tickets. I am currently juggling development with a full-time office job, eager to make the leap soon. Look forward to Hyperscaling. ⚡️

Deliverable-based crowdfunding platform powered by smart contracts.

Our goal is to build blockchain based escrow with crowdfunding as an initial usecase. Money is pooled into a smart contract and is released based on deliverables promised by parties seeking funds. Users should be able to verify deliverables before funds are released. Deliverables are minted as NFTs and sent to the smart contract. Portions of the escrow are then released to allow for more development to occur. Cofounding with @Ahmad Baracat

Feel free to reach out if interested! Looking to expand the team and raise a first round of capital to launch the MVP.

i'm building a crypto portfolio tracker for the rest of the world! crypto is extremely fragmented and can be very cumbersome for retail traders to keep track off. it's going to be integrated with all major wallets and exchanges.

I'm working on an on-chain investment advisory platform.

- Most retail investors crave Crypto-like returns, but also want simplicity (think Vanguard funds) . There's no middle path right now.
- All non-crypto assets are moving to chain slowly: Stocks, Commodities, Real Estate (via REITS), corporate/govt bonds, etc. This will create millions of investment options to choose from, confusing retail investors further.
- Good investments are not _accessible_ to everyone in the world for a few different reasons: regulatory hurdles against international investments, large ticket sizes.

Our goal is to enable portfolios/funds that:
- provide exposure to Crypto, Stocks, Commodities, REITS, bonds, etc and any combination of those.
- These could be ultra-low cost index funds or professionally managed funds that are fully transparent and auditable on chain.
- Since these will be owned as tokens, they can be traded in any fractional quantity (buy or sell even 0.0001th of a token).
- Additionally incentivize investors for providing liquidity.

This is quite early-stage, so would love any feedback/suggestions. I am an ex-Googler, working in FinTech space for the past couple of years.

Flow is the learn-to-earn platform 

that makes it possible for 'Dark/Hidden/Under-represented' talent to access the resources, opportunities, and network of the privileged ones (the 1%) through an asset-light and scalable approach of curation. 

We believe Flow could really pioneer Learn to Earn in a way how "Play to Earn" is being pioneered by the Metaverse and the NFT gaming platforms like Axie Infinity, Yield Guild Games, Decentraland, Gala, etc.

We see leveraging Web3.0 by taking a progressive decentralization approach at the platform level, by building the right Tokenomics to incentivize the users for their contributions to the ecosystem.  

We currently are exploring ways to set up a Curator DAO, which will let the curators contribute in a decentralized way, and earn actual money based on how much time and effort they put into the platform.

We have raised USD 80k from our users themselves, which includes investors in unicorns like Practo, Hackerrank, GoFundme, founders & leaders from places like NASA, Accel, MIT, and moreover, with conscious values, smart hacks and who acknowledge their privileges & strive to create a level playing ground for everyone.

Deck: https://docsend.com/view/w78sgqd695wqjiru
A fellow frog, an investor in Flow, building a learn-to-earn platform.

Have you looked at what Enzyme.Finance is doing with on-chain asset management.  Not a holistic solution (like what you’re talking about). But definitely an interesting new platform where performance is completely open-sourced and you can learn what the successful managers are doing to grow their funds
Enzyme looks cool, a bit like KaChing from web2. Ultimately they pivoted from the idea creating Wealthfront

Thanks, just took a look at it. Conceptually similar for sure. A few areas of improvement for Enzyme.finance I can spot:

1. Quite high fees. I saw performance fee of 10-20% + management fee of 2%.
2. Deposits/Withdrawals are gas intensive. I saw a few transactions where gas fee was ~10% of the deposit/withdrawn amount ($3000). (+fees incurred/effort on selling underlying tokens upon withdrawal). This makes it difficult for small ticket investors. There should be cheaper entry/exit options. 
3. It is not immediately obvious to me what vault managers can and cannot do. As in, the protections for investors in case of malicious actions by a fund manager. Might have to explore more on this.

I did like the overall UI and all the info available on fund details page, some in line with what I was visualizing. Thanks again for sharing.

Hi all 👋 Looking forward to this fund. Crazy to see it all come together so fast! I wanted to introduce my company Augmio https://augmio.com/ 

We're a media platform built for web3. So we deliver interactive XR media, where the ownership of the content is shared between the creators and their fans. You can also view, buy, and sell your NFTs in AR. We're live with our MVP and a few thousand users, and have an aggressive roadmap for this next year. We're ready to move fast. We'd love to be considered!
anyone want to practice their pitch? I'll be in the general voice channel for a bit and happy to chat about whatever you are working on. I want to meet fellow community members

Might as well describe my big idea. My company is revolut.io (pronounced with the io, forming the Latin origin of 'revolution'), and I've already grown a political data modeling service past prototyping and have made sales to some big clients (one of the major battleground races for U.S. Senate last year used our data and thinks it can transform earlier stages in the next cycle!).

The reason I left government and politics to start this company was because the way workers are treated internally is rotten. People who want to have an impact and a career start out in campaigns where they're paid less than minimum wage, and forced to work 15 hour days, 7 days a week. If you can't afford to do unpaid or underpaid internships or volunteer work, you don't get on the professional ladder, so only the affluent are really able to get in, and go on to have more powerful positions.

I wrote an online campaign labor platform, where candidates and advocacy groups can post tasks, and people interested in helping and earning money can perform them - a Mechanical Turk for politics, if you will. The prototype is a fully-functioning call-center, where workers can make calls from their home computers to voters, for polling, etc. There's a fundraising component that's been tested in real campaign settings, which onboards people wanting to make donations with a safe page linked with the worker's ID, allowing for commission-based tasks, and that plan is to add other tasks, including graphic design, data gathering, and "secret shopper" campaign quality checking.

The problem (of course) came when I went to implement the payment processing. Everyone here knows the strictness of finance companies. Stripe and other platforms will flag companies having anything that seems like "telemarketing", even if nothing is being sold, and ban them from the service. When this happened, I looked into financial transmission laws, and to do it on my own was a huge cost/gamble.

But I'm determined, and have identified a legal loophole that could be made to leverage interest in blockchain tech. There's a legal structure for corporations, called "worker cooperatives", that are allowed to have internal capital accounts for their member workers, and can distribute payments to those accounts based on patronage (work done for the cooperative). It's designed with having immediate democratic government in mind, and it fits with the goal of making this as-beneficial to the workers as possible, and therefore as disruptive to US party politics as possible. All of this could be accounted for with tokens, and able to be verified to ensure public trust. The proofs of work could also then be a type of badge people have that lets them have bragging rights - "I worked on this historic campaign"; "I have spent thousands of hours fighting for immigrants", etc.

This would require an investment into the legal work that would make the project air-tight, as well as increasing server-capacity and marketing the platform. But it has the chance to grow into something that non-profit civic-tech has failed at - providing the incentives for people to work for the change they want, and organize to pressure politicians. It could transform the "capital intensive" campaign style we have now to one focused on the power of individuals to create change. And it would open the gates to people who currently aren't represented fully in politics - low-income people, people of color, ex-felons, the disabled - and create opportunities for them to have real power.

A few different ways to do this but I'm thinking most beneficial way would be to get retailers onboard first where they register the existing UPC as the on-chain product code. Then we give them access to the data by building out tools and dashboards for optimizing inventory and price setting - maybe some AI on top of it (this would be the incentive). Eventually others across the supply chain buy into it which would streamline supply chain since the data is liberated out of retail systems that are tracking the inventory.

I’m Daryl with Habit Hero. 

Habit Hero helps CEOs, sales teams & marketing departments develop habits statistically proven to drive higher income, confidence, happiness and more...

Habits missing from their daily routine - and if fixed - will drive better results, in life, business, career, and relationships.

Comes with a 30-day money-back guarantee.

PLUS if after 90 days you don't get 10x the value, you'll get 3x your money-back.

Here's how Habit Hero works:
✅ Daily Habit Prescribed For You + Tracker
✅ Daily Content & practical activities

Members of health care sharing ministries are exempt from the individual mandate requ...

messages.content:
We are building this at Citizen DAO and we're calling it Moxi. 

I've been studying healthshares & health cooperatives around the world. An alternative health insurance model is the perfect use case for DAOs & DeFi.

Really inspiring. I am thinking the case of real world gaint company like Apple, Google, Coco Cola... etc as examples.   

So based on your theory, take Apple as example, if we want to give the value back to iphone owners and engineers/manufacturers/ designer/pm instead of shareholders of Apple, you need a better abstract protocol than the established real world protocol(invest->invent>pmf>manufacturing->marketing &sales->managing...)

So basically we need invent a new protocol to provide a better value chain for end user, without profits keep inside companies to keep dominating market, since basically will rely on a protocol of community to invest R&D.

Not sure it could adopt to all the industry but it's super interesting!
China has a better health sharing model called "Mutual Aid Societies," but they have been getting shut down by the government.

In the US, the best health sharing company is https://sedera.com/. They are the only ones treating the business like a startup. All the others are spin outs of churches, which is not a bad thing, just not ideal. I've tested the UX of the top 5.

embeds.title: Medical Cost Sharing | Sedera
embeds.description: Sedera is a non-profit Medical Cost Sharing Community that offers a refreshing non-insurance approach to managing large and unexpected healthcare costs. Learn more.

messages.content: Do you have a plan to enable users to use pre-tax income?
I recall that being an issue with direct primary care + heath saving accounts.
Yes. We buy a credit union.

It still is a problem. There is a specific bill that was supposed to be decided on mid 2020, but it keeps getting punted downfield. It would determine how the IRS treats direct primary care, health sharing ministries, & Health Savings Accounts.
I'm not joking about the credit union. We've pivoted Citizen Health to Citizen DAO.
And the cooperative is a DAO now.
What else are you doing that sedera isn't?

We're entirely crypto-native. I stopped fighting with regulation and decided to go all in. While I've been working for the past 4 years on cracking the US healthcare system, I've recently decided to go outside the US to implement this new model.
Where are you going?
Probably Guatemala first.
Here's part of the idea: https://www.loom.com/share/be87e42056784896991e4c6df4e9e9a5

embeds.title: MIT Health Innovation Pitch
embeds.description:
*Update* Citizen Health is transitioning to Citizen DAO. Everything mentioned in this video is now part of our health initiative at https://citizendao.com/. 

To learn more, I invite you to join our Discord community: https://discord.gg/SVKqEmrnM4

messages.content: Very promising, but huge obstacles. Come through Panama when you're done in Guatemala. 👍

HUGE obstacles. The best path for success in the US is with self-funded employers & startups. Most self-funded employers are part of a captive, which is effectively a DAO. The UX doesn't differ much other than saving 20-40% of admin fees.
El Salvador is also on the radar.
The slide about BobJones.eth needing an MRI and recording that with an ENS name seems like it would be a problem from a privacy standpoint if you do this on the ethereum blockchain.
Ah, I just saw the announcement about the "Write race for DAOs" on Mirror. We're officially launching Citizen DAO on Mirror Monday or Tuesday. We'll definitely be applying!
Like I wouldn't want someone to be able to look up my medical history on etherscan

Haha. For sure. Me either. That video was from 6 months ago, so things have changed. Now it will be BobJones.cdao.eth and will be his personal health record. The actual purchase of the MRI will be done via the Citizen Health Fund.
And now Bob Jones can anonymize his health data into a pool that leases access to researchers.
ah ok, as long as you're aware! I'm relatively new to ethereum and it surprised me how many people use IRL names as their ENS name with their main wallet with balance and entire tx history
Privacy is a big deal to me. I consider BrennenHodge.eth my public profile to represent my Web3 reputation, both the good and the bad.
Replace an HSA? What about pre-tax investment?

No, not replace the HSA. We could jump through some hoops with cooperatives & credit unions to get the pre-tax benefits, but we decided to rethink how to pay for healthcare altogether. There's no need to worry about losing the tax benefits when your Web3 health account generates yield much higher than what you lost.
Instead of monthly health expenditures, now you have monthly health investments.
The general concept.
What's your strategy for adoption and onboarding clinicians? I've been investigating direct primary care lately and it seems like it would be a great place to start.

You're right, DPC is the leader in direct payments for healthcare services. There are many more specialties & facilities opting out of insurance in favor of immediate payment. 

If the clinician accepts Visa for their services, they are already onboarded.
I spent a while onboarding these direct pay providers in order to form a cash pay network, but then it hit me that everyone who accepts Visa is already the network.
Awesome! Love the work you're doing.
My application to the fund focuses on a clinical team DAO that breeds sub DAOs. I'm particularly interested in a DPC DAO.
Would love to contribute if you need labor.
Oh yeah, that's an awesome idea! You can build out remote & physical care teams with DPC at the core.
Thanks, same to you. I have a solid network of clinicians if you need to talk to anyone.
Thanks! Educating clinicians to join will be the difficult part but I've got a decent network as well at my hospital system.

I’m in home healthcare, but we were just purchased by Honor (a unicorn tech company) so I’m sure they have a plan for us. I currently am both private pay and use Optum for reimbursement from govt contracts.
Yeah, getting clinicians to adopt new workflows is a difficult task, especially if you are a "business person." Are you a physician?
Medical student! So soon to be
Probably milking Medicare patients! Haha. Na, there are lots of good possibilities for home health. We need to focus on keeping people out of the hospitals.
An attending I’m working with is interested in this space and I can get him on board for sure

Yes we are funding *only* DAOs

We rebuilt the website. Shipping this with phase #2 shortly
Should be clear now

I am building a global #Bitcoin Credit Card powered by your friend, family, colleagues

Imagine a Decentralize Bitcoin Credit Card called #Friendscoin on block chain with public display of credit and debit transactions and Bitcoin for payments

It's automated in how you initiate credit request from your friends, family, colleagues and the blockchain nodes protect everyone from defaulting on repayment, once your network, of friends, family, approve your credit, you transfer to your existing bank account via any crypto exchange and we use incentives to ensure whatever is lended gets prepaid so you can consistently access credit with your trusted peers

Building/Ideating in public with @YousefAEN 

**DeTruth:** We build the tech for verifying truth, from news to tweets, to government policy and elections by tracing their origins and amendments over time.

**More details:**
When was the last time someone you know was fooled by a deepfake? How do you feel about a future where a post or tweet can be edited or removed to fit a personal or political agenda? What about if someone takes your work off DeviantArt or Behance and creates NFTs out of it without your permission or knowledge?

What we're proposing is a set of tools to help verify the authenticity of statements, videos, posts and provide immutable and undisputed provenance, ownership and accountability for content created on the internet.

We aim to do this through a set of proprietary smart contracts that provide this level of protection, the governance and strictness of which is determined by the participating community and people with skin in the game.

This involves attempting to solve hard problems/questions:
*Game Theory aspect*
* How can we incentivize people to tell the truth about the work they're creating?
* How can we de-incentivize people to lie about the work they're claiming credit for?
*Process & Technology aspect*
* How can we verify that people are ‘really’ the creators of an artifact? Maybe enable Minting through blueprints (.psd, source code) vs. artifacts (.jpeg, .apk)?

I applied!  I’m very excited to begin building my project that will revolutionize music.  Soundromeda: an outer space-themed virtual metaverse where any music artist can create visually immersive song planets for their fans to experience.  Soundromeda is designed for music as the visual layer to the audio with a revenue stream programmed to be in the artist’s favor.

Just applied for our project (with my co-founder @kasra), our platform is an **Escrow & Launchpad for NFT-based projects**, hopefully we'll get great feedback from the team (our public application for anyone interested: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15cAqHdYxRE88TnI35iL0j9jtNdPwoJeDQ2yVoUWivq4/edit?usp=sharing).

We've been actually working aligned with vision of Hyperscale, but with focus on NFTs, even if we don't get a chance to be accepted to play our role in this movement, we will be learning a lot definitely 🙂 

Thanks to all core team and every single contributor here, such an important and exciting experiment this is... LFG for a DAO-based world! 🚀
@hawtlava

Copy pasta by request: On a bit of a tangent - in terms of madness of the crowds and capital allocation, I recall seeing something about how the most voted for project gets funded, and those who voted for a funded project get a token.  This seems ripe for abuse since the popularity of submitted projects are currently visible to all, and at present, the leading project is miles away more popular than the runner up...
Very true, the solution would likely be each voter (participant) get a token irrespective of voting for the winner of the Race.
I don’t know if that’s the right solution.
If the intent is everyone in the community gets a "thanks for participating/voting" reward, then sure.

However, if tokens are intended to reward something else (helping pick "winners" for investment) I don't think that's the right solution.  I think in this case awarding tokens should be based on some demonstrated effort that helps the community make the "best" investment choices.

@kevalin  Perhaps the simplest way is to continue rewarding tokens to those who voted for an idea that gets funded, but hide the votes each applicant has received until after voting has closed.  This 1) minimizes abuse, and 2) incentives the community to actually review applications and not just lemming into the frontrunner, while 3a) minimizing "noise" from RNG voting and possibly 3b) minimizing no/low-effort voting in the first place.
In phase 2.5 members vote by comparing two DAOs
The idea of hiding votes is promising. People won't have a # of votes but more of a score going forward
https://hyperscale.notion.site/Phase-2-5-DAO-Leaderboard-2-0-4dc8e8a71f0b49ba9ffb34e6504a3587

embeds.title: Phase 2.5: DAO Leaderboard 2.0
embeds.description: Refine the leaderboard ranking algorithm

messages.content: This looks promising as people are incentivesed to invest it will ends in better investing

All 4 of those sound good.  How "comparing two DAOs" will work in practice will be interesting if it requires real work.  Simple voting for 1 of 2 still leaves the door open to more noise, with the chance some will just 50:50 vote without putting in any work.
@kevalin I think limiting votes, weighing outcomes, and having a clear incentive structure, done in combination, could have great results
Yeah need a good ranking algo

I just have my risk management hat on right now, thinking of ways people will want to abuse this for "free" tokens.  If everyone gets the same incentive irrespect of the work they put in, you'll end up incentivizing bad behavior and disincentivizing good
Needs to be a penalty for making random votes
Like your vote gets weighed negatively & your reward gets deducted from if the DAOs you vote on don't receive investment

Would rewards for positive outcomes be better than penalties in this case?  Since you can create an unlimited number of user profiles and wallets, it's easier to just create a new avatar for voting and reset your rank to 0 if you get too negative

Or if the penalty structure is preferred, we could build in some structure that rewards community tenure to counter the unlimited avatars issue?  For example, perhaps the longer the tenure, the more votes (even fractionally, with a cap)?  That would disincentive starting new avatars and have people try harder not to go negative.
From the pov of the ranking algo, how it handles negative weights/ coeffs. would be a fun problem to tackle

You'd want to give people who vote with good intent but just have bad ideas (or good ideas that are too outrageous to get community buy-in) some way to get positive.  On that note....does this encourage people to vote for the company they actually think is the best, or the company they think everyone else is likely to vote for? 🧐
Some way to define and measure success of all applicants, and link that back to who voted, would seem ideal in the long-run?

I think some key questions to ask would be 1) how do we define a successful vote (ie. most voted for = funded = successful vote?), 2) how to reward / penalize good and bad votes, and 3) how to address potential abuses like the "reset" mechanism, while keeping the algo in mind at all times.

@kevalin I did some more thinking about this and put together a possible implementation that might promote desired behaviors and help train an AI down the road: https://docs.google.com/document/d/16wkatpxgPMAtP-QnifRukwZM3Al8_WfBXxGfPVcLZOY/edit?usp=sharing

embeds.title: Hyperscale Investments
embeds.description: Hyperscale Investments  Guiding vision (per Sama ) Be the most effective capital allocator in the world, at all stages and at hyper scale. Train the best AI for asset allocation.  Desired outcomes Investment by consensus DAO / community driven investing AI driven investing  Problems:  People hav...

messages.content: Thanks! Will read over this soon!

Awesome! There was a lot of previous discussion about trainability, as well as the proper voting structure to avoid some of the problems you've correctly highlighted. I'll check out the doc here as well.
On the voting side, while this isn't 100% polished, here's the voting proposal I'm working on: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZBLjm1wD9mITtZsSkPUrmsTfJGoWQ_0lkAfVAAkus2c/edit?usp=sharing

embeds.title: DRAFT: HyperscaleDAO Voting Proposal - Meritocratic Quadratic Voting

Traditional VC firms consist of a small number of highly trusted participants generating deal flow and deciding on investments...

messages.content: Hey. I've learnt about Hyperscale through Idena. I've read about it and have a question regarding swapping $HYPE for tokens of the race winner. Is $HYPE available for sale somewhere? How does someone liquidate $HYPE won in the race?

@hawtlava  @kevalin 

The value or number of tokens awarded for picking the winner should dilute if the winner is a landslide. Suggests it was an easy choice.

Also means that brigading is dilutive and at least carries some kind of penalty.

Maybe have a fixed number of tokens eg 100 and if the winner gets 100 votes then 1 token each, but if winner gets 1,000 votes then 0.1 tokens for each voter.

This way you might be more rewarded for picking a qualifying 3rd place than a runaway winner.
Also votes should be hidden
That’s an interesting take
Votes should be hidden for sure to prevent no-effort pile up voting for free tokens

Yeah so for example

1st place = 100 tokens for voters, pro rata 
2nd place = 100 tokens for voters, pro rata
3rd place = 100 tokens for voters, pro rata
I’m not sure incentivizing people to vote for 3rd place is a good approach, but the concept that any single idea could be “oversubscribed” is interesting
Sure, it depends how many prospects in a round
Also caps the token minting
Presumably if vote results were hidden until the round closes, any landslide would be representative of independent DD and not some abuse of the system
It could really mess with AI training to incentivize people voting for “runner up” projects instead of a “clear winner”
That’s not so obvious
But if we’re permitting votes for runners up, the approach I suggested (paper portfolio) could readily express that
Well you are voting for a winner, but if you then start pumping your selected vote in forum you run risk of it being dilutive
You wouldn’t necessarily get two votes
You’re just counting votes and ranking, then sending tokens per rank on a pro rata basis
Maybe you don’t even need to reward for the runner up?
Just pro rata the winner
I think that’s a more clear cut approach to start with, yes
The approach you’ve suggested initially where a voter might receive greater reward for voting for an undersubscribed underdog seems a bit like handicapping or sports betting
But non obvious prospects are often the correct ones
Yes. Long shot bets where the payoff skews in your favor is great
But I’m not sure when you’re handicapping against yourself (ie. Every voter is a member of the same community trying to pick the best ideas for the community as a whole to fund) if that works well
Runs into the “good of the one” vs. “good of the many” issue I raised in my doc
Back to this though, I agree.  If we measure success based on which companies are funded, full stop, we run the risk of funding “obvious winners” that in hindsight might not be the highest ROR
Another problem with a winner takes all and voters being rewarded for lemming / herd behaviour is that it can defeat DD
We are rewarding blind herds
And by extension, people who voted for moonshots that won (ex. Airbnb) get zero or negative recognition if we measure “reliability/competence” strictly on whether they could “group think” the best
Yeah that was the initial problem I raised with kevalin
Hiding doesn't stop brigading.
When it’s a clear sweep you can close your eyes and vote for the landslide victor, guarantee yourself a token, but offer no benefit (or possible negative) to your team
This seems like an easy place for more prediction market style mechanics.

Reputation based voting solves most of this. One should not be able to vote by holdings, but rather by reputation in their domain (e.g. devs with a lot of reputation in their domain vote, which signals the project is strong on code). Etc.
I don’t know if I’d agree with that
Merit should come from picking right, not necessarily domain expertise (although it should help!)
Reward could come from picking right. But weight of the vote should be reputation (which needs to be earned)
Yes! That's almost exactly my proposal (though I call it "merit"). QV does away with some of the issues with picking just because everyone else is.
I’d agree with this.  Accountants are notoriously bad investors for instance.
But how to determine “right” isn’t that easy
I'd posit that "right" should be an objective measure.
So, why not "received follow on funding above X" or "token went above purchase price by %" or something like that?
I mean, we can judge good investments right?
Postfact.

The value of the token should be tied to the equity stake HS takes in the investee.

If HS takes 5% equity, maybe 2% of that 5% is distributed to voters pro rata.

If they pick a popular dud their tokens are worthless.
@Inklin Oh, I like that - I had thought the stake was fixed.
It aligns much more with actual value
There was some talk about a variable stake and variable $ investment
Works with any investment stake
My personal issue with this is how frothy the market is right now
There’s a lot of hype, no pun intended
And clear shitcoins doing very well as “investments” in the last 12mo
We should think longer term than that though. This mechanism should outlast market cycles
@Inklin The QV version of this adds that you only get X "credits" to vote with, and each vote for a particular DAO costs more each time.
I'm happy to pick another objective measure RE: valuing investments.
"Beating Market by X" is a well worn one.
How good are the shitcoins in relationship to the S&P risk adjusted? 😛
That’s not a good measure until they have a real track record
Of course.

Full disclosure, I literally took some money and spread it across the lowest priced coins I could find and it turned out amazing.  But if you asked me to explain fundamentally why they’re worth what they’re worth, I couldn’t tell you 😅
Are we trying to get to a fundamental?
I don’t think we’d want to invest hyperscale or Sam’s money that way
I don’t think fundamentals are required at all
😂 I would guess 2022 might be even better looking at commodity inflation.
I am an ex-trader for a multinational.  You can make great $ trading shit
Anyway… gifting liquid prizes to people who participate in easily riggable contests is foolish.
But I don’t think that’s hyperscales desired outcome.  We’re investing in ideas not playing with fire
What if the token was less liquid?
Or divorced from $HYPE?
Then what is it?
I've not finished my thinking on it yet, but I'm intrigued by these investment tranches being independent tokens, futures on that round, roughly.
Most VC/PE funds measure ROR/IRR at the exit
I don’t think that’s the problem. It’s the fact we reward herds
So liquid, but let the market decide on worth.
I think we’re getting a bit ahead of ourselves
Yes
Right now, we have a diverse community of potential voters, and one person footing the bill for investment
For this to succeed long term, that person (Sam) wants investments to be community driven, but at the same time presumably wants to not lose all his invested capital
I think we should focus on how to make sure Sam’s experiment is successful, and to incentivize behaviors that make initial rounds of investment a success
Maybe we elect eg 25 trusted voters and have them vote on 10 prospects?
Simple
I think the downside of that is you’d just lose 90% of your community overnight
In the early days (like 2 weeks ago) everyone offered ideas and discussion
Is everyone here to play shark tank?
More recently I see a lot more “token when?”
If you have a centralized body that makes all decisions that’s all you’ll be left with pretty quick
I agree 100%
I called that out recently
One idea I had for a DAO/web3 project that might work is to slowly decentralize

For example, start the first round with Sam&co. holding 50%+ of decision tokens with the community (as he sees appropriate) hold the balance, and then every round some of those centrally held decision tokens are burned
So gradually grind down centralized control while maintaining culture and direction in earlier rounds
Or maybe not burned in this case, but awarded to people who “voted right”, however defined
Interesting! Hm. Devolves control AND economics? Are they transferrable?
They would be, why not
I think part of the problem is on day 1 you have nothing and on day 2 you only have the simplest of things.
Sam isn’t losing money per se.  The tokens value should go up in value. It’s not different than going thru fundraising
Initially founders own 100%, at seed maybe 90%, by IPO maybe sub 10%?
That makes sense, I think in the future HS will offer DAO in a box with many of these sort of features and configs built in.
But Hyperscale needs to do the hard yards.
Got to go through the stage of having nothing built
Yes
I think the advantage here is most of us are here because of Sam
Yes. The governance thread has been interesting these past 2 days.
Because of that level of implied trust, hyperscale doesn’t “need” to solve the Byzantine general’s problem so to speak (or at least for now, most people will give Sam the benefit of the doubt)
That said, I’d think the first token drop could be a make or break moment and should be very well thought out and communicated in advance
Yes, I think keeping the community engaged in the mean time is equally important
I think while it’s probably not the best solution long term, the best way to maintain community engagement is to reward voting that coalesces around a funded company
And then iterate from there
If you really want community driven, and eventually AI driven investment decision making, it’s probably the only approach that works on day 1
We should have entire DAO on AI we can take help of OpenAI as well

People have no incentive to vote on strong projects. An upvote from an investor with a strong track record is equal to one with a poor track record. (Notion, Phase 2.5) for this problem People have no incentive to vote on strong projects. An upvote from an investor with a strong track record is equal to one with a poor track record. (Notion, Phase 2.5)        We should have quadratic voting

Potential abuses from people who just want tokens.  Ex. Herd mentality voting. Give tokens to those who are from start and are helping from start only on proof of purpose and work tokens should be assigned accordingly ?

Voting for “most likely to be funded” vs. “best idea”.  Do you want the best investment return (good of the many), or a higher likelihood of receiving a token (good of the one)?  in long run the best Idea or else in extreme situation Core should decide it or else let Sam Altman intervene

messages.content: and my wallet should be connected now. Thanks @hawtlava

Hi All, I added a proposal to the race. 

Enigma - Think Cicada 3301 as a DAO 

Where the community designs the worlds most awesome riddles, puzzles treasure hunts, etc.
Enabled by a utility token that can be earned (e.g. through creating riddles. The longer it takes to solve the riddle, the higher the reward to the creator. Riddles can be IRL, hacking challenges, etc. and will be chained to lead up to a full Enigma-Phase where the prize for solving all the challenges would be crypto based reward. NFTs, Enigma tokens, or even the seed phrase to a stuffed wallet. 

This is a very early stage concept, but I believe with the support of the community we could turn this into a very cool (and fun) DAO. 

Please consider placing a vote in the support for Enigma. Also feel free to hop into the discord if this is something you are interested in.

https://www.hyperscalefund.com/dao-race/61ccd6a1818aa552964ec053
3LAU's younger brother is does puzzle NFT drops
Forgot is `@`
Cool concept

Thanks @kevalin. Its just a conept right now, so not sure it really qualifies for investment. But could be a super interesting (maybe higher risk) bet. I secretly think if we can knock out a solid concept with the community in the next few weeks, and tweet at Mr Beast to partner up for the launch of Enigma 1.0, its right up his alley. 😄
Hunt for a wallet with 1000ETH in it or something crazy like he always does. 😛

**Simple staking system**
We want to build a meritocratic fund where the best investors receive capital to deploy. A great way to measure conviction is staking. Margin accounts are a good model. Investors put up collateral to borrow against. When the market moves against their position they're liquidated.

> An investor puts up 100 USD to open a 200 USD position. When this position drops 50% they're liquidated.

Investors with a strong track record could trade with more leverage. Skilled investors could also use this system to rapidly build up their track record.

cc: @Qworg
This model could integrate well with Qworg's proposal
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZBLjm1wD9mITtZsSkPUrmsTfJGoWQ_0lkAfVAAkus2c/edit?usp=sharing

messages.content: How might cost of capital be structured? More debt-like with interest rate? Or more equity-like with percentage of upside going back to HS?
Good question! My first instinct is equity-like, as I think it aligns things better and protects the DAO, but I'm open.
collateral would be no use because there is always high volatility. We need to have feature like Aave or else only take investors who have lot of money ?

messages.content:
Because it is too labor intensive and subjective to come up with a valuation of an early-stage company, one lacking any historical financial data that would be accepted by everyone. This is compounded by the fact that investors would have to do this for every company they entered into due diligence with. Early-stage investors often are individual angels who don't have the skills to value a company, even if they had historical financials. this is why individual valuations usually start at the seed stage and are done by a lead investor who is selected at least in part because they can do valuations.

The solution for this is a standardized deal and terms found in a SAFE or in a priced round. Most often done at the pre-seed stage. Yes, there are a range of amounts invested and what percentage of the company given up depending on the investors involved, e.g., YC commands a better deal because of who they are, and the team/traction of the startup. What this does is to create a band that everyone can use to see if their deal falls within "market" or not.
In essence we have to make it atleast a bit one sized fits all
